alert.note: Alert for Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:04AM EST until December 31 at 3:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Bluffton IN. * WHEN...From late tonight to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water reaching the bottom of the bridge at East River Road and 450 East. River Road and a few county roads are closed by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 10.9 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 04/19/1920. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
